newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan Nov crude steel output up 6.9 pct yr/yr.
newsitem.headline: Japan Nov crude steel output up 6.9 pct yr/yr.

text.p: Japan's crude steel production rose to 8.63 million tonnes in November, up 6.9 percent from a year earlier, marking the second successive month of year-on-year rises, the Japan Iron and Steel Federation said on Monday.
November output was down 1.7 percent from October, the federation said in a statement.
November output of tin plate was 129,700 tonnes, down 12.8 percent year on year, and down 3.9 percent month on month, it said.
Production of galvanised steel sheet in November was 966,600 tonnes, up 4.1 percent year on year, but down 2.3 percent month on month, the federation said.
